trans-unit.source: Represents an initializer for a single element of an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> collection.
Gets the instance method that is used to add an element to an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> collection.
A <xref href="System.Reflection.MethodInfo"></xref> that represents an instance method that adds an element to a collection.
Gets the collection of arguments that are passed to a method that adds an element to an <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> collection.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref> objects that represent the arguments for a method that adds an element to a collection.
Returns a textual representation of an <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ElementInit"></xref> object.
A textual representation of the <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ElementInit"></xref> object.
Creates a new expression that is like this one, but using the supplied children.
If all of the children are the same, it will return this expression.
The <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.ElementInit.Arguments"></xref> property of the result.
This expression if no children are changed or an expression with the updated children.
Returns the number of arguments to the expression tree node.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
Returns <xref href="System.Int32"></xref>.
Returns the argument at index, throwing if index is out of bounds.
You should not use this member.
It is only public due to assembly refactoring, and it is used internally for performance optimizations.
The index of the argument.
Returns <xref href="System.Linq.Expressions.Expression"></xref>.
